activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan R. Scott

records.addlTxt:
Court modifies bond conditions so that the Defendant must stay out of the Town of Orion and any thoroughfares through there as well as the Village of Muscoda (the village itself and any routes going through it), continuing to have no contact with the victims or their residences. Previous conditions of bond including the no drink conditions remain in effect.

ON 09/15/22: Court amends the bond to allow no violate or abusive contact with SM.

3:00 PM Defendant Jonathan R. Scott in court.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Jonathan R. Scott.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Meyer O'Day states that he has received an offer from the state and would waive the preliminary hearing. JS agrees with waiving the preliminary hearing. Court binds over for trial. 

Attorney Forehand asks for an arraignment date. Attorney Meyer O' Day asks for a date after August.

Attorney Forehand states that there is a motion to modify bond and the victim states they she did want some contact with JS. Attorney Meyer O'Day comments and asks that the no contact be removed completely from the bond.

Victims speaks that she would like to see the no contact lifted.

Court lifts the no contact and will change the no contact to no violate or abusive contact with SM. All other conditions continue.
Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
to modify nonmonetary conditions of bond

1:57 PM Defendant Jonathan R. Scott in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Jonathan R. Scott. Attorney Meyer-O'Day state that his client gets calls from victim one but doesn't answer. Attorney Forehand speaks about an amended complaint that will be filed but hasn't been signed by law enforcement yet. Attorney Meyer-O'Day states that the amended complaint yet to be filed doesn't change the motion to dismiss. 

Court has review the motion and the complaint. Attorney Meyer-O'Day speaks about the motion that was filed. Attorney Forehand heard about the incident and does think there is grounds for these charges. Attorney Meyer-O'Day comments. 

Court heard and denies the motion for dismissal. 

Attorney Meyer-O'Day states that a preliminary hearing needs to be held and will be filing another motion due to concern about victim one calling his client.

Any motions that will be filed will be addressed on 09/15/22 at 3 PM during the preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
to dismiss counts 1 and 2 on the four corners of the complaint
Bond reduced from $10,000 to $1000.00. $9000 refunded to the poster on 7/21/22.

ADDRESS INFO for Jonathan R. Scott
Current: 1180 Spruce St, Plain, WI 53577 United States  (Effective: 07-21-2022)
Prior: 1150 Spruce St., Plain, WI 53577

7/21/22: Court modifies bond conditions so that the Defendant must stay out of the Town of Orion and any thoroughfares through there as well as the Village of Muscoda (the village itself and any routes going through it), continuing to have no contact with the victims or their residences. Court reduces the amount of the bond to $1000 cash. Previous conditions of bond including the no drink conditions remain in effect.

9:00 AM Defendant Jonathan R. Scott in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Jonathan R. Scott. Atty. M-O argues for modification of bond, presently cash; there's also a non-monetary condition that the Def remain outside of Richland County. Defense argues that Def currently resides in Plain, outside of Richland County and that the Def has no issue residing outside of Richland County; Defense argues, however, that, being prohibited from being within Richland County is a constitutional violation of his right to travel; additionally, Def's work requires him to travel and it is inconvenient for him to do his work, having to avoid any travel in Richland County. Atty. Forehand argues the State's position; asserts that cash is appropriate in this case and the statute provides for the conditions set to allow for the safety of the victim; notes the allegations in the case which includes threats made by the Def to persons within Richland County; State believes there needs to be some radius within the victim's home so that Def not come into contact and suggests within 5 mile radius of the victim's residence. Court notes there are 2 victims listed. State asks for the 5-mile radius which would cover both victims' residence locations. Defense argues for a 1-mile radius prohibition. Court modifies bond conditions so that the Def must stay out of the Town of Orion and any thoroughfares through there as well as the Village of Muscoda (the village itself and any routes going through it), continuing to have no contact with the victims or their residence. Court reduces the amount of the bond to $1000 cash.
of Monetary and Nonmonetary Conditions of Bond

1:30 PM Defendant Jonathan R. Scott in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Meyer O'Day appears in person. JS hasn't had a chance to review the complaint but waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Attorney Meyer O'Day waives the time limits of the preliminary hearing. Attorney Meyer O'Day will be filing a motion to dismiss which will be heard on 08/15/22. Modification of bond will be filed and heard on 07/21/22.
Motion hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on August 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:10 PM Attorney Forehand appears in person. Attorney Erickson appears by zoom. Defendant Jonathan Scott appeared by video, in custody. 
Attorney Forehand asks for a $25,000 cash bond. 

With conditions:
No contact with KSB (DOB 07/27/87), KLB (DOB 01/24/94), and SMN (DOB 10/01/92) or their residence. 
Not to be in Richland Center except for court hearings. Not to be in the village of Muscoda. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.
Not to possess any firearms and to surrender any firearms that the defendant owes to RCSD.

Attorney Erickson comments about the states request.
Defendant speaks about places to go.

Court orders:
$10,000 cash bond

With conditions:
No contact with KSB (DOB 07/27/87), KLB (DOB 01/24/94), and SMN (DOB 10/01/92) or their residence or any location temporary occupied by them. 

Not to be in Richland Center except for court hearings. 

Not to be in the village of Muscoda. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

Not to possess any firearms and to surrender any firearms that the defendant owes to RCSD within 12 hours of release.

Initial set for 07/13/22 at 1 PM
